column2: Successfully contributes to an inclusive organizational culture
column4: Interacts respectfully and appropriately with people from a wide variety of backgrounds & life experiences. Understands and adapts to cultural differences in communication, relational, presentational and other styles/preferences and norms. Is self-aware of own cultural styles/preferences and norms. Understand how one's own background (cultural, socio-economic, generational, educational, etc.) impacts how one perceives other people and situations. Regularly seeks out opportunities to learn about the histories, cultures, experiences, etc. of people from a wide variety of backgrounds & life experiences.
column6: Highly regarded facilitated dialogues to help participants learn about and dismantle systemic racism, build strategies for resistance and alternatives, and promote healing

column2: Successfully contributes to an inclusive organizational culture
column4: Interacts respectfully and appropriately with people from a wide variety of backgrounds & life experiences. Understand how one's own background (cultural, socio-economic, generational, educational, etc.) impacts how one perceives other people and situations. Regularly seeks out opportunities to learn about the histories, cultures, experiences, etc. of people from a wide variety of backgrounds & life experiences.
column6: NLI offers a variety of highly praised workshops related to building diverse relationships, cultivating diverse participation and leadership, leveraging the power of diverse teams, and more. Check website for information on upcoming workshops or email <natural.leaders@cornell.edu>.

column2: Successfully contributes to an inclusive organizational culture
column4: Interacts respectfully and appropriately with people from a wide variety of backgrounds & life experiences. Understand how one's own background (cultural, socio-economic, generational, educational, etc.) impacts how one perceives other people and situations. Regularly seeks out opportunities to learn about the histories, cultures, experiences, etc. of people from a wide variety of backgrounds & life experiences.
column6: Opening Doors (offered on the Cornell campus) is a highly valued, time-tested workshop model for creating a climate for constructive change on diversity for individuals and organizations. Opening Doors offers a foundational understanding of diversity that supports staff in developing a deeper awareness, understanding and skills for effectively working across differences. Cost is $495.

Opening Doors is a highly valued, time-tested workshop model for creating a climate for constructive change on diversity for individuals and organizations. Opening Doors offers a foundational understanding of diversity that supports staff in developing a deeper awareness, understanding and skills for effectively working across differences. The registration cost for the workshop is $495 and includes all workshop materials, lodging and food.

column2: Can build effective relationships with people from diverse backgrounds. Understands how achieving equity and inclusion requires a combination of personal behaviors, organizational practices, and institutionalized policies.

column2: Knows CCETC financial policies and procedures

column6: CCE Tompkins offers Kronos and Meal Break Training to all new employees (trainings offered bi-monthly by HR).

column6: CCE Admin Program Planning and Development resources. Examples: The "Netway" as an Evaluation Tool- Research and Practice around Evaluation, Data Collection Instrument Design

column2: Can develop new evaluation tools

column2: Can analyze evaluation data and deliver results

column2: Can perform a needs assessment
column4: Needs assessment; program planning tools (e.g., logic models); program evaluation methods and tools; reporting; marketing.

column6: CCE Admin Program Planning and Development Tools: Assessing Local Needs, Program Advisory and Governance Structures, Assessing and Strengthening Audience Participation

column2: Can help set program direction and create programs
column4: Helps set association direction in program area based on emerging community needs and statewide Plans of Work. Creates innovative educational programs and develops new educational strategies to meet diverse community needs and goals.

column6: CCE Admin Program Planning and Development: Strengthening Programs Using Logic Models, Formal Program Planning Including Statewide and Local Plans of Work

column2: Can create positive connections with faculty and other contributors to program
column4: Develops and maintains relationships with Cornell University faculty and staff, community leaders, and others.
column6: This website provides links to pages that can provide connections to existing work groups and a way to reach out, as well as tips on building relationships.

column2: Knows CCETC policies re: volunteers
column4: Knows CCETC policies re: volunteer recruitment, screening, and registration. Can complete necessary forms to comply.

column2: Can recruit, retain and supervise diverse volunteers appropriately
column4: Is able to identify and reach out to under-represented groups for volunteer opportunities, recruit them, and retain them as fully contributing members of program teams.
column5: CCE Administration Diversity Resources - Recruiting and Retaining Diverse Volunteers
column6: CCE Administration provides several resources surrounding recruiting and involving diverse volunteers.

column2: Can provide guidance to volunteers
column4: Is able to effectively lead a group of volunteers in program activities, providing instruction and feedback on an ongoing basis.
column6: CCE Administration provides several resources surrounding working with volunteers.

column2: Can provide low complexity administrative tasks surrounding marketing and promotion of the program
column4: Is able to utilize existing program materials to create accurate and enticing descriptions for community members to view that will help them understand what the program offers and get them excited about participating.
column6: Web-based training videos on many topics.  Muliple topics related to marketing. Free to staff with Cornell NetID.

column2: Can present information about programs and offerings to the public in a community/tabling forum
column4: Is able to utilize program related knowledge to verbally communicate with community members in a way that will help them understand CCE and Program content and get them excited about participating.

column2: Can assist program leaders in developing marketing strategies
column4: Contributes program related feedback and suggestions to discussions surrounding future marketing opportunities and changes that may be made to improve outreach to different communities.

column2: Able to perform high level administrative tasks in planning for communication and marketing efforts related to the program or position function
column4: Can effectively plan marketing and communication strategies, utilizing input from a program team and/or the community.  Is able to translate strategies into marketing and communication plans and efforts.

column2: Able to perform complex tasks related to organizational marketing efforts and communications
column4: Can collaborate across programs to develop shared communication and marketing strategies, major public affairs events, and mass media efforts.

column2: Can provide effective guidance to others

column4: Understands Cornell & CCETC policies re: working remotely and appropriately communicates policies to team members and effectively supervises those working off-site.

column2: Can resolve conflicts within the team
column4: Can solve problems and resolve conflicts that arise in operation of the program.  Is able to effectively mediate conflicts between two or more employees to provide long lasting improvements to team dynamics.

column2: Can resolve conflicts within the team
column4: Can solve problems and resolve conflicts that arise in operation of the program.  Is able to effectively mediate conflicts between two or more employees to provide long lasting improvements to team dynamics.

column2: Can effectively build and lead a team effort
column4: Is able to identify strengths in team members and build effective and collaborative projects, utilizing the diffences of the individuals to the advantage of all.

column2: Can provide supervision, guidance and leadership to other supervisors
column4: Efficiently, effectively and positively assists supervisors to build their skills and develop appropriate professional improvement plans. Identifies or develops adequate resources for supervisor development. Anticipates and plans for emerging supervisory needs and opportunities. Understands best practices for ensuring accountability across the association.

column2: Can assist staff to plan staff development opportunities
column4: Is able to lead staff and team in goal-setting and developing professional improvement plans, utilizing available resources, performance evaluations, and position descriptions.

column2: Can assist staff to plan staff development opportunities

column2: Can provide performance feedback & performance reviews
column4: Is able to effectively deliver effective ongoing feedback to employees and deliver annual performance evaluations that provide employees opportunities to improve and grow in their career goals and improve the program and team.

column2: Can provide performance feedback & performance reviews
column4: Is able to effectively deliver effective ongoing feedback to employees and deliver annual performance evaluations that provide employees opportunities to improve and grow in their career goals and improve the program and team.
column6: In-person training with Human Resources - Providing Effective Feedback - contact HR to schedule.

column2: Awareness of Personal Strengths and Values
column4: Knows one personal strengths (e.g., talents) and can use them to achieve desired work outcomes.
column6: An online assessment, personalized report and ideas for action that apply a strengths-based model to improving one's effectiveness, engagement and enjoyment at work. Purchasing the book, with a code for the online assessment, is the most cost-effective approach.

column2: Ability to make positive changes.
column4: Can identify areas for change, create strategies, and implement positive changes in work and personal lives.

column2: Career Advancement
column4: Is able to identify a suitable direction for career advancement and create a plan for achieving it.
